titleStmt.title: H. S. Young to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2106

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Oakwood K. Y.
May the 8th 1865
To his Excelency
Hon Thomas E Bramlet

Dear Sir They are a vacancy in the office of Justice of the peace in the 6 District in Fleming County which was ordered to be filled at the May Election and from some, ^cause^ no Election was held I am requested by many of the good citizens of the district to say to you if concistant with your office not to commition anyone that is recommended untill we elect one which we will do at the august Election our reason for maken this request is because no one who is capable of filling the office will have it with out the voice of the people & we have a very good Magistrate in the District who can attend to all the business
